answers.author: Israel Murguia
answers.text:
Lore, 
According to the Maryland Municipal League, in Maryland, assistant manager/administrator positions are rarely if ever incorporated into the charter.  While somewhere between 20 and 25 municipalities in the state have assistant positions, they're not aware of any that spell out that position in their charter.  Of the four largest council-manager governments in the state, none mentions an assistant manager within the charter.  The League feels very confident that if any cities or towns in Maryland require the swearing in of their assistant manager, they are very few and far between.
